intro: Senecio culcitenellus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by distinctive, elongated seed capsules.
